definitions.definition: A piece of nonfictional writing such as a story, report, opinion piece, or entry in a newspaper, magazine, journal, dictionary, encyclopedia, etc.
An object, a member of a group or class.

(grammar) A part of speech that indicates, specifies and limits a noun (a, an, or the in English). In some languages the article may appear as an ending (e.g. definite article in Swedish) or there may be none (e.g. Russian, Pashto).
A section of a legal document, bylaws, etc. or, in the plural, the entire document seen as a collection of these.
definitions.example: The Articles of War are a set of regulations [...] to govern the conduct of [...] military [...] forces

definitions.definition: A part or segment of something joined to other parts, or, in combination, forming a structured set.
definitions.example: Each of the chelicerae is composed of two articles, forming a powerful pincer.
She's a prime article (whip slang), she's a devilish good piece, a hell of a goer.

definitions.definition: A precise point in time; a moment.
To bind by articles of apprenticeship.
definitions.example: to article an apprentice to a mechanic

definitions.definition: To accuse or charge by an exhibition of articles or accusations.
To formulate in articles; to set forth in distinct particulars.
